name: Elastic Security (threshold)
description: Mapping Elastic Secrity Detection Rules (https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules) to ATTACK Navigator

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: AWS IAM Brute Force of Assume Role Policy

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number of failed attempts to assume an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. IAM roles areused to delegate access to users or services. An adversary may attempt to enumerate IAM roles in order to determine if arole exists before attempting to assume or hijack the discovered role.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Cloud AWS Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: AWS Management Console Brute Force of Root User Identity

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number of failed authentication attempts to the AWS management console for the Root user identity. Anadversary may attempt to brute force the password for the Root user identity, as it has complete access to all servicesand resources for the AWS account.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Cloud AWS Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Sudo Heap-Based Buffer Overflow Attempt

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies the attempted use of a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability for the Sudo binary in Unix-like systems(CVE-2021-3156). Successful exploitation allows an unprivileged user to escalate to the root user.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Host Linux macOS Threat Detection Privilege Escalation]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Potential SSH Brute Force Detected

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number (20) of macOS SSH KeyGen process executions from the same host. An adversary may attempt abrute force attack to obtain unauthorized access to user accounts.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Host macOS Threat Detection Credential Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Attempts to Brute Force a Microsoft 365 User Account

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies attempts to brute force a Microsoft 365 user account. An adversary may attempt a brute force attack to obtainunauthorized access to user accounts.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Cloud Microsoft 365 Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Potential Password Spraying of Microsoft 365 User Accounts

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number (25) of failed Microsoft 365 user authentication attempts from a single IP address within 30minutes, which could be indicative of a password spraying attack. An adversary may attempt a password spraying attack toobtain unauthorized access to user accounts.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Cloud Microsoft 365 Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Attempts to Brute Force an Okta User Account

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies when an Okta user account is locked out 3 times within a 3 hour window. An adversary may attempt a bruteforce or password spraying attack to obtain unauthorized access to user accounts. The default Okta authentication policyensures that a user account is locked out after 10 failed authentication attempts.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Identity Okta Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Okta Brute Force or Password Spraying Attack

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number of failed Okta user authentication attempts from a single IP address, which could be indicativeof a brute force or password spraying attack. An adversary may attempt a brute force or password spraying attack toobtain unauthorized access to user accounts.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Identity Okta Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: High Number of Okta User Password Reset or Unlock Attempts

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: Identifies a high number of Okta user password reset or account unlock attempts. An adversary may attempt to obtainunauthorized access to an Okta user account using these methods and attempt to blend in with normal activity in theirtarget's environment and evade detection.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Identity Okta Continuous Monitoring SecOps Identity and Access]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: Potential DNS Tunneling via NsLookup

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: This rule identifies a large number (15) of nslookup.exe executions with an explicit query type from the same host. Thismay indicate command and control activity utilizing the DNS protocol.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Host Windows Threat Detection Command and Control]

techniques.comment: Showing at least one example detection rules:

metadata.name: Rule name
metadata.value: High Number of Process and/or Service Terminations

metadata.name: Rule descr.
metadata.value: This rule identifies a high number (10) of process terminations (stop, delete, or suspend) from the same host within ashort time period. This may indicate a defense evasion attempt.

metadata.name: Rule type
metadata.value: threshold

metadata.name: Rule tags
metadata.value: [Elastic Host Windows Threat Detection Defense Evasion]
